body.p: Two petitions have been presented to his Excellency Governor Magoffin by C. Redinger and C. Veihman, who had been found guilty of the offence of selling Liquour to Minors, at the August term of our Circuit Court, their object was to pray a remittance of the Commonwealth portion of their fine, both parties being very poor and unable to pay their fine have requested ^me^ their Attorney to Address you and to pray that if said petitions should have reached you to attend to their Cases as soon as possible and in doing you will oblige Sir

Your most Humble & Obt. Svt.
J S. Geisler
Atty at Law
Newport Ky.
To his Exellency Governore Robinson of Kentuck
